plugins.name: Design QA: Identify, Annotate and Track
plugins.description: Identify and annotate bugs for your Design QA using our custom annotations, and track all the bugs in one place with our bug tracker table. Save time and effort while keeping track of your raised bugs in a single location.How to Use:Create a frame or rectangle over the section of the screenshot or Figma design you wish to annotate.Keep the frame or rectangle selected.Run the plugin.Enter necessary information such as the page name where the bug was found, component, details of the discrepancy, expected behaviour, and direction for the annotation.You have multiple options:Choose between Design QA mode or Annotation mode. Note: Annotation mode does not create the QA tracker.In Design QA mode, you can choose to create a new table when starting a new QA round.You can opt to mark spacing that creates an arrow on the selected direction of the frame instead of creating an outlineClick 'Generate' and let the plugin do the work!Tracking and Collaboration:Keep track of all bugs in the bug tracking table and share it with your engineering team for a comprehensive list of issues.Note:Initial Use: The first time you run the plugin in Design QA mode, a tracker and status component is created. Subsequent annotations will add entries to this tracker. For annotation mode, a global counter is created. Please don't delete this node. We're using this node to keep track of number of bugs raised.Manual Adjustments: Some details, such as the points of contact for the project, design links, and browser details used during QA, will need to be manually updated.Edit with Ease: Undo and redo changes using standard cmd+z and cmd+shift+z. Ensure that entries in the tracker and annotations remain consistent. This might need multiple cmd+zs to bring it to a previous state.We are committed to enhancing this tool to make it the ultimate companion for Design QA, continually adding features to simplify the QA process for designers. Please feel free to reach out for issues, suggestions and/or feature requests.

accepted.name: Headout Inc.
accepted.description: Creating innovative plugins and resources for the Figma community. Follow us for tools, insights, and design inspiration!

accepted.name: Mukul Chaturvedi
accepted.description: I am a Self-taught designer passionately in love with anything and everything related to designing.

plugins.tagline: Simplify design QAs with auto annotations and bug tracking

plugins.name: Auto Size Text - AutoFit
plugins.description: AutoFit Text is a plugin that automatically resizes text to perfectly fit its container. Designed to save time and enhance design consistency, this tool is perfect for various applications, including media localization, where different languages often result in varying text lengths. With AutoFit Text, you no longer need to manually adjust text sizes, ensuring a smoother, more efficient design process.Features:Automatic Resizing: Effortlessly fits text within its container.Adjustable Scaling: Choose whether the plugin should only reduce text size or also increase it.Use Cases:Media Localization: Automatically adjust text size for translations.Poster Design: Ensure all text fits beautifully within design elements.Social Media Graphics: Create visually appealing graphics with perfectly sized text.AutoFit Text simplifies your design workflow, allowing you to focus on creativity. We welcome any feedback at michael@apployal.co to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Automatically resize text to fit its container

plugins.name: Visibility
plugins.description:
To use:
1. Add to the layer's or folder's name "~visibility" in the layer panel. Make sure "~visibility" is all lowercase as the plugin is case sensitive.
2. Launch the plugin

The plugin will hide the layer or folder if it is visible and vice versa.

plugins.name: Folder Structure
plugins.description: üåü Figma File Organizer PluginThe Figma File Organizer Plugin is a powerful tool designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to organize your Figma files with ease. With this plugin, you can create folders and subfolders, helping you keep your design assets structured and accessible.Configuration- Create a figma personal access token (it is recommended to create a token with no expiration period, all the other settings will be left on default) and save it for later¬†¬†- While making sure you are signed into your figma account in the web browser, open https://www.figma.com/api/user/state in a new browser tab¬†¬†- In the downloaded JSON file, search for "personal_drafts_folder_id" and save the value associated to this key (this is your drafts folder id)¬†¬†- Open the plugin and go to the Configuration tab¬†¬†- Insert in the forms the figma personal access token and the drafts folder id that you saved above and press the Save config button‚ùó Features1. Folder and Subfolder CreationEasily create folders and subfolders to categorize and group your Figma files. The plugin provides an intuitive interface for creating folders directly in the plugin interface.2. Move FunctionalityEffortlessly move files between folders using a simple drag-and-drop interface. This intuitive feature allows you to rearrange your files and folders seamlessly.3. Rename and DeleteCustomize folder names to suit your project's needs. The plugin also supports the deletion of folders, providing flexibility in managing your design assets.¬†üôå How to UseAccessing the Plugin:¬†¬†- Open a Figma file.¬†¬†- Navigate to the Plugins menu.¬†¬†- Select "Folder structure" from the list of installed plugins.¬†¬†- Use the folder structure functionality from the Folder Viewer tabCreating Folders:¬†¬†- Click the "New Folder" button or press CTRL+Ins.¬†¬†- Name your folder and press "Enter."Managing Folders:¬†¬†- Drag files onto folders to organize them.¬†¬†- Press F2 with a folder selected to rename it¬†¬†- Delete the selected folders by clicking the Delete button or pressing the Del keyDrag-and-Drop:¬†¬†- Drag files between parent and child folders for quick organization.Copy-Paste files and folders:- Select the files and folders that you want to copy and press CTRL+C or use the left menu buttons- Go in the destination folder and press CTRL+V or the left menu buttonsüõë Limitations and RestrictionsDue to the way the Figma plugins work, there are some limitations:- Files can not be modified (Created, Deleted, Renamed) from this plugin, only organized under folders- You have to first access a file, then open the plugin to be able to view the folder structure- When opening files, they are opened in a new browser tab- ‚õî Be careful when clearing cookies and local browser storage as you will lose your folder structure- Files can not be moved outside the Drafts folder- Currently the plugin allows only Drafts managementThe Figma File Structure Plugin is compatible with the latest versions of Figma and is designed to enhance your design workflow by providing a seamless file organization experience.üöÄ Try it now and bring order to your Figma design files!
plugins.tagline: Easily organize your figma files in folders and subfolders

plugins.name: Everything Toolbox
plugins.description: Ok, well not everything. Currently the everything toolbox does four thingshttps://www.jpdesign.info/everything-toolboxQuick ActionsMake selecting layers a lot quicker. Select more similar layers, less layers, layers within layers...Text MergeSetup lists of data and easily merge it into your document, either by layer name or by selecting your text.¬†Default textSet a default style for all of your new text boxes. Reduces the time spent messing with styles.¬†To use there must be a style called _default which will be your default text style and the plug-in must be running!Frame/Art-board managerAdd your own custom sized frames to Figma, create your standard layouts without having to use components¬†Expose PropertiesSurface children components‚Äô properties when nested in parent components. Only supports Text & Layer properties right now.Update - This feature has recently become a little redundant. Figma has released this feature natively. I'll keep this feature in for now, but you can consider this deprecatedIf this has saved you some time, please consider supporting me buymeacoffee.com/?via=JPDesignHow to useText mergeFirst things first, you need to load your lists. We have some default ones for you here (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1zUKLsdsPHdoY9EhydyBKMDDECUTIyMOMSF-bnJ0WAPA/edit?usp=sharing), but to add your own go to ‚ÄòEdit lists‚Äô, copy it out of the text area (don‚Äôt try to edit it in that little box) and paste it into Google sheetsMake any edits you want and paste it back in, hit save and you‚Äôre doneThere are two ways to merge your lists:Naming layers, the first way is to name your layers to be the same as your list titles. Then just select a bunch of stuff and press merge.¬†Alternatively if you just want to merge a specific list to a bunch of text boxes, you can just select the text boxes, select the list and it will merge for you. This will find all the text in the area you selected, so if you want to be precise make sure you select the right layers.Exposed PropertiesTo simply expose a property, go to the component that has another instance of a component inside, select the instance (It can‚Äôt be an instance in an instance, but you can expose the property in that instance and then expose it further up, like a chain of props!)That‚Äôs it, you can now use the exposed prop. The Everything Toolbox needs to be running when you change the prop.When a property is exposed it will create a hidden group called _matadata, this is required to link the property. If you delete this the property will no longer be linked.
plugins.tagline: Figma Text management

plugins.name: Paletto - oklch palette generator
plugins.description: Introducing our Figma plugin designed to revolutionize your design process with seamless, consistent color palettes generated directly from your chosen HEX code. This innovative tool is engineered to accept a HEX code along with a list of lightness values, meticulously crafting a pure, balanced, and harmonious palette that integrates effortlessly into your projects.Key Features:HEX Code Input: Start with your favorite HEX color as the foundation of your palette, ensuring personalized and unique designs.Custom Lightness Values: Tailor your palette with a range of lightness options, allowing for versatile and dynamic color schemes.Consistent Color Palettes: Achieve a cohesive look across your designs with palettes that are clean, aligned, and consistent.Effortless Integration: Seamlessly incorporate generated palettes into your Figma projects, enhancing productivity and creativity.Whether you're refining the visual identity of a brand, crafting user interfaces, or developing digital illustrations, our plugin streamlines your workflow, offering an intuitive solution for creating the perfect color palette every time. Embrace the power of color consistency and elevate your design with just a few clicks.
plugins.tagline: Generate consistent color palettes from your favorite HEX

plugins.name: Confetti Pro
plugins.description: Effortlessly generate confetti-like designs by duplicating any elements on the screen. It works by creating multiple copies of selected Node(s) and distributing them along the X and Y axes in both directions, relative to the original Node.Key Features:Effortless Duplication: Select your desired Node(s), activate Confetti Pro, and watch as it swiftly duplicates and arranges them for you.Bidirectional Spread: Confetti Pro ensures copies are distributed both horizontally and vertically, giving you balanced results every time.Full Control: You have full control over the number of copies, spread and rotation.Live Preview: All changes are reflected in live design giving you the option to adjust and see how it work without closing the plugin. (Press cancel to delete and close if you don't like the design)Optimal Placement: For the best results, position your elements closer to the center of the frame to achieve an even spread of the duplicates.How to Use:Select the Node(s) you want to duplicate.Launch Confetti Pro from the Plugins menu.Adjust the settings to tailor the spread to your specific needs.When you are done, Click 'Apply' to save and close.If you don't like the output, Click 'Cancel' to revert and close.This is my 1st plugin, Let me know your thoughts and feedback on this to make it better

accepted.name: Renga R
accepted.description: Product Designer with a decade of exp in designing Products, Websites, Design Systems, User research, user interviews etc. I also code for fun.

plugins.tagline: Effortlessly generate confetti-like designs by duplicating any elements on the screen.
